title: WO-01: Freeze global verification command
intent: Add and freeze a global verification command runnable from repo root.
forbidden: Do not modify files outside allowed_files.
Do not add conditional tool-based logic (no checking for npm, git, etc.). Keep scripts/verify.sh minimal and always-run.
Do not attempt to run unit tests in this step. Tests do not exist yet and unittest discovery may exit nonzero when no tests are present.
notes: Type: scaffold. Contracts: scripts/verify.sh is the frozen global verification entrypoint and must be included in every future work order's acceptance commands. It must be non-interactive and deterministic, and it must run all automated checks without manual inspection. Implement scripts/verify.sh as exactly 3 lines (no extra blank lines): (1) #!/usr/bin/env bash (2) set -euo pipefail (3) python -m compileall -q . Make it executable (100755). Do NOT include any cd command; the harness runs this script from the repo root. Patch formatting requirement: for the new-file hunk use @@ -0,0 +1,3 @@ and ensure the count matches exactly 3 added '+' lines (no truncation). Compositionality: later work orders may strengthen verification by adding tests and then extending verify.sh to run them, but the command path and non-interactive deterministic behavior must remain.
